definitions: slice of bread browned by heat on both sides
act of raising glasses to honor someone or celebrate something special
examples: She spread butter on her morning toast
The smell of fresh toast filled the kitchen
Everyone stood up for a toast to the newlyweds
He proposed a toast to celebrate their success

definitions: electrical device with heating elements designed to brown slices of bread
examples: The toaster popped up the perfectly golden bread
She bought a new four-slice toaster for the kitchen

definitions: process of browning bread using heat to make it crispy
act of raising glasses together in honor or celebration of someone
examples: The toasting process takes about three minutes
She enjoys toasting her bagels until they're golden
The toasting of the bride and groom was heartfelt
Everyone participated in toasting the guest of honor

definitions: flat-bottomed sled curved upward at the front for sliding down snow
close-fitting knitted cap worn in cold weather without a brim
examples: The children raced down the hill on their toboggan
We packed the toboggan with blankets for the ride
She pulled her toboggan down over her ears against the wind
His colorful toboggan kept his head warm during skiing

definitions: young child who has recently learned to walk typically between ages one and three
examples: The toddler stumbled across the playground with wobbly steps
She enrolled her toddler in a music class for socialization

definitions: warm drink made with liquor mixed with hot water sugar and spices
examples: He sipped a hot toddy to warm up after skiing
The bartender prepared a whiskey toddy with honey and lemon

definitions: chewy or hard candy made by boiling sugar and butter together
examples: She unwrapped a piece of English toffee after dinner
The toffee stuck to his teeth as he chewed

definitions: soft white food made from pressed soybeans used in Asian cuisine
examples: She marinated the tofu cubes before stir-frying them
The restaurant serves grilled tofu with vegetables

definitions: loose flowing garment worn by ancient Roman citizens made from single cloth piece
examples: The senator adjusted his toga before addressing the forum
Students wore makeshift togas to the themed party

definitions: switch or button that alternates between two states or positions
rod-shaped button passed through a loop to fasten clothing
examples: Click the toggle to switch between light and dark modes
The toggle on the dashboard controls the headlights
She fastened her coat with wooden toggles and loops
The duffle coat featured traditional rope and toggle closures

definitions: physically demanding work that requires great effort and causes fatigue
examples: Years of toil in the fields aged him prematurely
Their daily toil began before sunrise on the farm

definitions: object or gesture serving as a sign or symbol of something else
coin-like piece used instead of money for specific purposes like transit
examples: She gave him a ring as a token of her love
The trophy served as a token of their achievement
He inserted a token into the subway turnstile
The arcade games required special tokens to play

definitions: willingness to accept beliefs behaviors or opinions different from one's own
ability to endure difficult conditions or substances without adverse effects
examples: The community showed great tolerance for diverse viewpoints
Teaching tolerance helps children respect cultural differences
Her tolerance for spicy food increased over time
The medication dosage depends on patient tolerance levels

definitions: practice of permitting something that one dislikes or disagrees with to exist
examples: Religious toleration became law in the progressive nation
His toleration of the noise showed remarkable patience

definitions: small building or structure where drivers pay fees to use roads or bridges
examples: Cars lined up at the tollbooth during rush hour
The tollbooth operator collected fees from passing vehicles

definitions: male cat especially an unneutered adult male domestic cat
examples: The neighborhood tom prowled the alleys at night
Our tom cat guards his territory from other males

definitions: light axe used as tool and weapon by Native American peoples
examples: The museum displayed an authentic ceremonial tomahawk
Warriors carried tomahawks for both hunting and combat

definitions: vault or chamber for burying the dead often marked with monuments
examples: Archaeologists discovered an ancient pharaoh's tomb
Fresh flowers adorned the family tomb on memorial day

definitions: girl who enjoys activities and behaviors traditionally associated with boys
examples: She was a tomboy who preferred climbing trees to playing with dolls
The tomboy excelled at sports and outdoor adventures

definitions: stone slab or monument marking a grave with inscribed information about the deceased
examples: The weathered tombstone bore dates from the 1800s
They placed fresh flowers beside her mother's tombstone

definitions: unneutered adult male cat especially one that roams and fights
examples: The old tomcat had scars from many territorial battles
That tomcat howls outside our window every night

definitions: large heavy book especially one dealing with serious or scholarly subjects
examples: She struggled to carry the ancient tome to the reading table
The professor referenced several dusty tomes in his lecture

definitions: unit of weight equal to 2000 pounds in the US
informal expression meaning a very large amount or quantity of something
examples: The truck can carry up to five tons of cargo
A ton of steel was delivered to the construction site
She has a ton of homework to finish tonight
We had tons of fun at the amusement park

definitions: organization of musical pitches around a central note creating sense of key
examples: The composer shifted the tonality from major to minor
Jazz musicians often experiment with unconventional tonality

definitions: fine powder used in laser printers and photocopiers to form text and images
cosmetic liquid applied to skin to cleanse and tighten pores
examples: The printer displayed a message that toner was running low
Black toner cartridges need replacing more often than color ones
She applied toner to her face after cleansing
The facial toner helped reduce the appearance of pores

definitions: liquid medicine believed to restore health vigor and well-being to the body
carbonated water containing quinine used as mixer for alcoholic drinks
examples: Grandmother swore by her daily herbal tonic for energy
The doctor prescribed an iron tonic for her anemia
He ordered gin and tonic with a slice of lime
The bitter taste of tonic water comes from quinine

definitions: total weight that a ship can carry measured in tons
total weight or amount of something measured in tons
examples: The vessel's tonnage determined its port fees
Shipping companies calculate rates based on tonnage
The mine's annual tonnage of coal decreased significantly
They measured the tonnage of recycled materials collected

definitions: metric unit of mass equal to 1000 kilograms or approximately 2204 pounds
examples: The shipment weighed exactly one tonne
European trucks measure their capacity in tonnes

definitions: portable box or chest designed to organize and store hand tools
examples: He carried his red metal toolbox to the job site
She organized the screwdrivers in her toolbox by size

definitions: animated character from cartoons especially in a stylized or exaggerated form
examples: Classic toons like Bugs Bunny remain popular today
The movie mixed live actors with animated toons

definitions: brief sharp sound made by a horn whistle or similar instrument
examples: The train gave a loud toot before departing
She heard the toot of a car horn outside

definitions: pain in or around a tooth often caused by decay infection or injury
examples: His toothache kept him awake all night
She made a dentist appointment for her severe toothache

definitions: small brush with handle used to clean teeth and gums
examples: She replaced her toothbrush every three months
The electric toothbrush cleaned more effectively than manual ones

definitions: paste or gel used with toothbrush to clean and maintain healthy teeth
examples: He squeezed toothpaste onto his brush before brushing
The minty toothpaste left her mouth feeling fresh

definitions: hard transparent or translucent gemstone typically yellow but found in various colors
examples: Her engagement ring featured a blue topaz surrounded by diamonds
The jeweler showed them several topaz stones in different hues

definitions: art of trimming shrubs or trees into decorative shapes or the shaped plants themselves
examples: The garden featured elaborate topiary shaped like animals
She learned topiary techniques to create geometric hedge designs

definitions: detailed description or representation of natural and artificial features of an area's surface
examples: The map showed the region's complex topography
Hikers studied the topography before planning their route

definitions: person or thing that surpasses all others in achievement or quality
decorative item placed on top of something especially a wedding cake
examples: She was the topper in her graduating class
The show's finale was a real topper
They chose a vintage topper for their wedding cake
The birthday cake topper spelled out her age in candles

definitions: ingredient or mixture put on top of food to add flavor or decoration
examples: She ordered extra cheese topping on her pizza
The ice cream sundae had chocolate topping and nuts

definitions: sail set above the lowest sail on a mast of a square-rigged ship
examples: The crew furled the topsail as winds increased
The ship's topsail caught the morning breeze perfectly

definitions: upper deck or above-deck part of a ship
lean cut of beef from the inner thigh of the animal
examples: Passengers gathered topside to watch the sunset
The captain ordered all hands topside for inspection
The butcher recommended topside for the Sunday roast
She slow-cooked the topside until it was tender

definitions: uppermost layer of soil containing organic matter and nutrients for plant growth
examples: The gardener spread fresh topsoil over the flower beds
Erosion had washed away much of the farm's topsoil

definitions: high rocky hill or peak especially on moorland in southwest England
examples: Hikers climbed to the ancient tor for panoramic views
The granite tor stood prominently above the moor

definitions: stick with combustible material at one end used as a light source
battery-powered portable electric light called flashlight in American English
examples: Olympic runners carry the torch to the games
Medieval guards patrolled with flaming torches
She grabbed a torch to search the dark basement
The torch batteries died during the power outage

definitions: light produced by a burning torch or the illumination from a flashlight
examples: They explored the cave by flickering torchlight
The torchlight revealed ancient paintings on the walls

definitions: past tense of tear meaning ripped or pulled apart forcefully
examples: She accidentally tore her dress on the fence
He tore the letter into pieces in anger

definitions: severe physical or mental suffering causing extreme pain anguish or distress
examples: The prisoner endured months of torment in captivity
Jealousy was a constant torment in their relationship
